column1: Burkitt lymphoma is a very fast growing form of non-Hodgkin lymphoma.
Burkitt lymphoma was first discovered in children in certain parts of Africa, but it also occurs in the United States.
The African type of Burkitt lymphoma is closely associated with the Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), the main cause of infectious mononucleosis.
Burkitt lymphoma may first be noticed as a swelling of the lymph nodes (glands) in the neck, groin, or under the arm.
The disease can also start in the ovaries, testes, brain, and spinal fluid.
